posts.post_content:
@majinara: constructed decklists disagrees.  
  
This is no [Spectral Procession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Procession). It is, however, easier to splash and is an instant, and [Intangible Virtue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intangible Virtue) and [Honor of the Pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor of the Pure) can really make those tokens worth their cost.

posts.post_content:
I can't believe no one's said it yet, but [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek). Two 1/1 fliers and double draw for ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)? Yes.  
  
Also, @JMF2796... STORM CROW IS NEVER TAKEN BY SURPRISE. You've got it the wrong way round. You aren't surprising Storm Crow and killing him, he is surprising you and reducing this card's effect by 50% at the cost of his life! He's dedicated like that.

Posted By: DritzD27 (2/4/2012 9:19:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's great limited design to have this, [Village Bell-ringer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Village Bell-ringer), and [Rebuke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rebuke) all at the same mana cost. Leaving mana open for a turn with cards in hand telegraphs something, but what? It takes a good read of the board state to figure out which one. Did they attack recklessly, leaving themselves open for lethal damage? Did you just play a bomby flyer that he needs to take out? Sure makes attacking with your [Reaper from the Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper from the Abyss) more scary. Beating down with your [Lantern Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lantern Spirit) or [Vampire Interloper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Interloper), or eyeing the lone [Thraben Sentry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thraben Sentry) holding the fort? I'm not the biggest fan of Innistrad drafts, because it rewards the greediest plays ever. But I admire the design!
posts.html:
It's great limited design to have this, Village Bell-ringer, and Rebuke all at the same mana cost. Leaving mana open for a turn with cards in hand telegraphs something, but what? It takes a good read of the board state to figure out which one. Did they attack recklessly, leaving themselves open for lethal damage? Did you just play a bomby flyer that he needs to take out? Sure makes attacking with your Reaper from the Abyss more scary. Beating down with your Lantern Spirit or Vampire Interloper, or eyeing the lone Thraben Sentry holding the fort? I'm not the biggest fan of Innistrad drafts, because it rewards the greediest plays ever. But I admire the design!
